meanings.definition: A two-masted sailing vessel with the mizzenmast stepped forward of the rudder post.
meanings.sent1: The old ketch sailed gracefully on the calm sea.
meanings.sent2: We saw a beautiful ketch gliding through the water.
meanings.sent3: The ketch seemed to wink at the other boats as it passed by.
meanings.sent4: The ketch was a silent dancer on the waves.
meanings.sent5: The ketch's sails billowed like giant wings in the wind.

meanings.sent1: I will try to ketch the ball when you throw it.
meanings.sent2: She tried to ketch the butterfly fluttering by.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to ketch the elusive red dot on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to ketch her attention instantly.
meanings.sent5: The idea ketched in her mind like a spark igniting a fire.
